thread.title: Cop responds to 911 call about fight, ends up dancing in music video

author: USA TODAY Network
title: Cop responds to 911 call about fight, ends up dancing in music video

organizations.name: university of ontario institute of technology

text:
Cop responds to 911 call about fight, ends up dancing in music video A Toronto police officer decided to take Lady GaGa’s advice and Just Dance after responding to a 911 call about a fight, which ended up being a music video shoot. USATODAY.com: http://usat.ly/2kOBfct   Join the Nation's Conversation   Cop responds to 911 call about fight, ends up dancing in music video USA Today Network Mary Bowerman , USA TODAY Network 11:54   A Toronto police officer decided to take Lady GaGa’s advice and “Just Dance" after responding to a 911 call about a fight, which ended up being a music video shoot. (Photo: Screenshot) CONNECT COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
A Toronto police officer decided to take Lady GaGa’s advice and Just Dance after responding to a 911 call about a fight, which ended up being a music video shoot. 
Const. Jarrod Singh with the Durham Regional Police Service in Toronto responded to a call Sunday about a fight in downtown Oshawa, CBC Toronto reported. Instead of a fight, he stumbled upon the University of Ontario Institute of Technology dance troupe filming a music video, CBC reported. 
"I saw eight people gathered around one person, so I can see how a member of the public thought it was a fight," Singh told CBC. "But when I got closer I could see he was break dancing in the middle, and there was someone filming it." 
After checking out the scene, Singh decided to show the dancers his moves. 
Not too shabby!
